summary: Hi babe, could you maybe write something about y/n being insecure about her body after being pregnant, which results in her...
question: Hi babe, could you maybe write something about y/n being insecure about her body after being pregnant, which results in her being more distant from Harry. I really love your writing especially HOME 🧡 lots of love
answer:
I’m getting really shit with answering requests aren’t I? I’ve been sitting on this one for a while because I wanted to do it some justice but I’m super proud of it so I hope you are too!

Pregnancy always was enchanting to Harry. He’d said it on so many occasions, that you being pregnant, a little swollen belly and glowing skin, your hair full of a whole new bounce and your eyes exceptionally bright, was his absolute favourite thing. Knowing that you were homing his little baby inside until he or she was ready to come out into the world, it was like you were a gift from the Gods.

Your entire pregnancy he’d barely left your side, attending to your every need and answering your every beck and call. He was like a footman, concierge, bodyguard, chef, barman, spa therapist and waiter all at once, he was just always there. At one point early on he’d started to irritate you with how much fuss he was making over you, but you never mentioned it because you knew it would only cause an argument not worth having, and you knew you’d come out the other side looking extremely ungrateful.

And then your daughter was born and everything changed.

Harry had noticed your distance from him. No, not from the baby, from him. You were infatuated with her, barely left her alone to the point that when Harry held her you were jealous. But you seemed to shy away from him at every opportunity, avoiding his touch and affection towards you like you hated him.

Even with your daughter sleeping between you in bed for the first few months, after she started sleeping in her cot you still slept right on the edge of the bed, as far away from him as possible. The doctors recommended six weeks before having intercourse again, and here Harry was four months later feeling a little heavy down below.

You’d also started wearing pyjamas in bed, something you’d never done before, not even when you were pregnant. And they weren’t particularly flattering either, not that Harry would ever say anything, he’d just always admired that you used to be comfortable enough around him to sleep naked.

But the truth was you didn’t hate him, quite the opposite in fact. You just didn’t feel worthy of him anymore, because not only were you no longer pregnant but your body was also no what it used to be. You’d never been particularly thin anyway, but even still you’d never felt less confident in yourself.

You’d heard a girl call her legs tree trunks once and thought she was ridiculous for putting herself down in such a way, but now you can certainly see where she was coming from when you look down at your own legs. Your stretch marks grew from the curve of your arse all the way down to your mid thighs, and they were even worse on your still bloated stomach, stretching right across your front so that you looked like a fucking weird coloured tiger.

Yeah, you’d never felt like a match for your husband before, so you certainly didn’t feel like one now.

A small bubble of noise came from the Moses basket beside your bed, pulling you from your light slumber. In your new conscious state you’re aware of the fact that during the night Harry has edged his way into the middle of the bed and laid a lazy arm over your side, lacing his fingers with yours. It makes you feel guilty.

You sit up, slipping your hand out of his to fawn over your little girl’s blanket. You’re aware that Harry’s hand has remained glued to your fleshy hip as you start to coo at your baby, his thumb rubbing a soft circle into your buried hip bone, indicating that he’s awake.

“Hi pretty girl.” You whisper quietly to her, beaming down at her as you stroke her cheek while flutters her eyes open and closed, making the most adorable noises you think you’ve ever heard. “Did we have a good sleep? I think we did because it’s nearly nine o’clock and we’ve actually had a lie in.”

You can feel Harry’s gaze burning a hole in your back while his caresses become more fervent, his hand beginning to stroke up and down your waist under your pyjama top. It makes you nervous as you think of all the imperfections he can feel in your skin, all the little rolls he comes across every time he moves his hand up and then back down again. You decide to stop him, placing your hand on his and gently removing it whilst keeping your eyes on your seemingly happy four month old.

“Why’d you do that?” Harry voice comes from behind you, and even in its deep morning husk you can hear the offence behind it.

You’re not sure why you decide to play dumb because you know it’s not going to do you any favours. Maybe the early hour is making you stupid. “Do what?”

You hear a shuffle behind you, a you continue to play ignorant while you gaze at your baby girl, until Harry’s strong arms are around your waist - this time thankfully over your top - and his head is on your shoulder. You can feel his knees lightly digging into your sides, but that’s nothing compared to the hard beating of your heart.

“Why’d you keep pushing me away? Like you hate me?” He begs, curls brushing against your ear as he bravely kisses the side of your face.

“I don’t hate you.” You retort lightly, feeling more guilty that you’ve given that impression. “I could never hate you.” And that much is true. It’s scary really, how much you’d think to stick by him for.

He frowns, pulling his head back along your shoulder slightly to look at you. But you’re still too busy faffing over the baby who’s began to wriggle wildly. “What have I done then? Because I’m so confused, love.”

You’re not entirely sure how to answer. Your hands are too busy trying to carefully pull your infant from her cot without too much fuss, and it temporarily distracts you from his question while you settle her. “You haven’t done anything, Harry.”

“Angel, this is the longest you’ve consciously let me touch you since the day we brought her home.” He tells you with slight drain to his voice, his eyes glued to yours from the side. “What’s changed?”

That was easy enough. “I have.” You mumble, because you’ve been terrified to say it since your distance started. Your daughter begins wriggling restlessly, her noise still bubbling as she nods her head towards your breast.

“What do you mean, you have?” He sounds baffled. No, he’s definitely beyond baffled but he persists. “Because for me the only thing that’s changed is that we have a baby and you refuse to let me near you.”

You’re sure as hell not going to have this conversation facing away from him with an aching back. You sigh, a breathe filled with strange sadness, and turn your head to finally look at him. For the first time in months you’re the one to kiss him. Because he remains to be the most handsome man you’ve ever seen, and weirdly enough he’s yours and remains to be. “Can I sit properly to feed her first?”

Harry studies your gaze for a moment before nodding, pecking your lips back and detaching himself from you. He takes your infant from you, something that doesn’t please her much as she begins to cry while you quickly remove your t-shirt and settle a pillow against the headboard. Harry coos at her quietly until you’re holding your arms out for her again, cradling her in your arms and holding her head as she begins to feed.

“Seriously love, I think this is the first time I think I’ve seen you without a top on for months.” And he does sound serious, there’s not a hint of teasing present in his tone as he crawls to sit right beside you, facing you with his legs bent beside him, leaning on an arm that he’s sat between your half crossed legs.

“I just don’t feel good about myself anymore, Harry.” You finally admit, giving a light shrug as your expression reads a little helpless. “I feel… I don’t know, horrible. Big.”

Big. Without being insulting he tries to think of a way to tell you that you’re being… well, silly. “You’ve just had a baby… I didn’t exactly expect you to just go back to normal, love.”

“Doesn’t change the fact that I feel bad about myself. Like, I just don’t feel good enough for you.” Your daughter distracts you again as her mouth detaches from your nipple, and you’re quick to move her to your other breast.

As you do Harry reaches for the little cloth you keep with you, and without any hesitation he wipes the excess milk from your breast. “You think I care about any of that? Angel, I love you for you. You had a baby for me, I couldn’t give a shit if you’re a bit bigger because of it, it doesn’t matter, it’s natural. It certainly doesn’t change the fact that you’re my wife and I still adore you in all the ways I did before. It just means I’ve got a few more reasons to love you, and a few more things to love on.”

You let out a little laugh at his mini rant and watch him for a moment. He looks deadly serious, the smallest little line between his brows that tells you he means it. You do feel a bit silly, you should’ve seen it coming, but insecurity is a funny thing. “So you don’t mind that you suffocate if I ever lie on you again?”

Harry rolls his eyes and watches the humour spread across your face. “You are ridiculous, that won’t happen.”

“Might break it.” You mumble, nodding to his lower region. “M’quite heavy.”

“Stop it.” Harry scolds with a deeper frown, gently smacking your leg with the back of his hand. “Very much doubt you’ll break it. On the other hand m’balls are turnin’ blue.”

You have to snort at that. “Sorry.”

Harry shrugs and lean towards you to press a kiss to your arm. “S’alright, just promise me you won’t keep me waiting too much longer. Might combust otherwise.”

You giggle lightly. “I’ll think about it.”

~~~

~Part II~

Yeah, I actually love this so…

Pregnancy always was enchanting to Harry. Knowing that you were homing his little baby inside until he or she was ready to come out into the world, it was like you were a gift from the Gods.

Your entire pregnancy he’d barely left your side, attending to your every need and answering your every beck and call. He was like a footman, concierge, bodyguard, chef, barman, spa therapist and waiter all at once, he was just always there. At one point early on he’d started to irritate you with how much fuss he was making over you, but you never mentioned it because you knew it would only cause an argument not worth having, and you knew you’d come out the other side looking extremely ungrateful.

And then your daughter was born and everything changed.

Harry had noticed your distance from him. No, not from the baby, from him. You were infatuated with her, barely left her alone to the point that when Harry held her you were jealous. But you seemed to shy away from him at every opportunity, avoiding his touch and affection towards you like you hated him.

Even with your daughter sleeping between you in bed for the first few months, after she started sleeping in her cot you still slept right on the edge of the bed, as far away from him as possible. The doctors recommended six weeks before having intercourse again, and here Harry was four months later feeling a little heavy down below.

You’d also started wearing pyjamas in bed, something you’d never done before, not even when you were pregnant. And they weren’t particularly flattering either, not that Harry would ever say anything, he’d just always admired that you used to be comfortable enough around him to sleep naked.

But the truth was you didn’t hate him, quite the opposite in fact. You just didn’t feel worthy of him anymore, because not only were you no longer pregnant but your body was also no what it used to be. You’d never been particularly thin anyway, but even still you’d never felt less confident in yourself.

You’d heard a girl call her legs tree trunks once and thought she was ridiculous for putting herself down in such a way, but now you can certainly see where she was coming from when you look down at your own legs. Your stretch marks grew from the curve of your arse all the way down to your mid thighs, and they were even worse on your still bloated stomach, stretching right across your front so that you looked like a fucking weird coloured tiger.

Yeah, you’d never felt like a match for your husband before, so you certainly didn’t feel like one now.

A small bubble of noise came from the Moses basket beside your bed, pulling you from your light slumber. In your new conscious state you’re aware of the fact that during the night Harry has edged his way into the middle of the bed and laid a lazy arm over your side, lacing his fingers with yours. It makes you feel guilty.

You sit up, slipping your hand out of his to fawn over your little girl’s blanket. You’re aware that Harry’s hand has remained glued to your fleshy hip as you start to coo at your baby, his thumb rubbing a soft circle into your buried hip bone, indicating that he’s awake.

“Hi pretty girl.” You whisper quietly to her, beaming down at her as you stroke her cheek while flutters her eyes open and closed, making the most adorable noises you think you’ve ever heard. “Did we have a good sleep? I think we did because it’s nearly nine o’clock and we’ve actually had a lie in.”

You can feel Harry’s gaze burning a hole in your back while his caresses become more fervent, his hand beginning to stroke up and down your waist under your pyjama top. It makes you nervous as you think of all the imperfections he can feel in your skin, all the little rolls he comes across every time he moves his hand up and then back down again. You decide to stop him, placing your hand on his and gently removing it whilst keeping your eyes on your seemingly happy four month old.

“Why’d you do that?” Harry voice comes from behind you, and even in its deep morning husk you can hear the offence behind it.

You’re not sure why you decide to play dumb because you know it’s not going to do you any favours. Maybe the early hour is making you stupid. “Do what?”

You hear a shuffle behind you, a you continue to play ignorant while you gaze at your baby girl, until Harry’s strong arms are around your waist - this time thankfully over your top - and his head is on your shoulder. You can feel his knees lightly digging into your sides, but that’s nothing compared to the hard beating of your heart.

“Why’d you keep pushing me away? Like you hate me?” He begs, curls brushing against your ear as he bravely kisses the side of your face.

“I don’t hate you.” You retort lightly, feeling more guilty that you’ve given that impression. “I could never hate you.” And that much is true. It’s scary really, how much you’d think to stick by him for.

He frowns, pulling his head back along your shoulder slightly to look at you. But you’re still too busy faffing over the baby who’s began to wriggle wildly. “What have I done then? Because I’m so confused, love.”

For the first time in months you’re the one to kiss him. Because he remains to be the most handsome man you’ve ever seen, and weirdly enough he’s yours and remains to be. “Can I sit properly to feed her first?”

Harry studies your gaze for a moment before nodding, pecking your lips back and detaching himself from you. He takes your infant from you, something that doesn’t please her much as she begins to cry while you quickly remove your t-shirt and settle a pillow against the headboard. Harry coos at her quietly until you’re holding your arms out for her again, cradling her in your arms and holding her head as she begins to feed.

“Doesn’t change the fact that I feel bad about myself. Like, I just don’t feel good enough for you.” Your daughter distracts you again as her mouth detaches from your nipple, and you’re quick to move her to your other breast.

As you do Harry reaches for the little cloth you keep with you, and without any hesitation he wipes the excess milk from your breast. “You think I care about any of that? Angel, I love you for you. You had a baby for me, I couldn’t give a shit if you’re a bit bigger because of it, it doesn’t matter, it’s natural. It certainly doesn’t change the fact that you’re my wife and I still adore you in all the ways I did before. It just means I’ve got a few more reasons to love you, and a few more things to love on.”

You let out a little laugh at his mini rant and watch him for a moment. He looks deadly serious, the smallest little line between his brows that tells you he means it. You do feel a bit silly, you should’ve seen it coming, but insecurity is a funny thing. “So you don’t mind that you suffocate if I ever lie on you again?”

Harry rolls his eyes and watches the humour spread across your face. “You are ridiculous, that won’t happen.”

“Might break it.” You mumble, nodding to his lower region. “M’quite heavy.”

“Stop it.” Harry scolds with a deeper frown, gently smacking your leg with the back of his hand. “Very much doubt you’ll break it. On the other hand m’balls are turnin’ blue.”

You have to snort at that. “Sorry.”

Harry shrugs and lean towards you to press a kiss to your arm. “S’alright, just promise me you won’t keep me waiting too much longer. Might combust otherwise.”

You giggle lightly. “I’ll think about it.”

~~~

~Part II~

Yeah, I actually love this so…

summary: Love writing random things in 15mins that make no sense. Haha. I shall be gracious and share he confusion with you <3. Maybe you...
question: Love writing random things in 15mins that make no sense. Haha. I shall be gracious and share he confusion with you <3. Maybe you can make it better? ~~ It hard been so long ago that you had met. In amongst the drama of a bad day, probably long since forgotten in the horrible mood that had accompanied the meeting. He had been alone, head shoved in a book, face contorted in such a way that it looked as though he was fighting back tears. (1/?)
answer:
It had been that which had prompted you to approach him - ordinarily you liked to respect people’s privacy, but in that moment, on that day, he had just looked as though he needed someone, anyone. It wasn’t in your nature to leave someone alone when they were upset.

It had been such a brief meeting, full of forced smiles and maybe, just maybe, the hint of a genuine laugh.

You never had found out what had been bothering him. You hadn’t wanted to pry, you were just glad that by the time he left his eyes looked less hurt and frustrated.

You had never expected to see him again, never expected to cross paths. To have him smile, say hi, tell you he remembered you. Tell you that you had made him smile such a long time ago. Mention that he had never forgotten the way your eyes twinkled; or how your voice had blown him away.

How on that day so long he hadn’t wanted to be alone, and then along you had come.

You hadn’t expected to sit across from him in a coffee shop, sipping hot chocolate and have his words seared into your brain; words of encouragement and love. Words of expressed thanks you had never anticipated receiving. Words of a man you had merely just offered your kindness to. Words that you would cherish forever, just as it would seem he had done yours.

~~~

Admittedly when this first came in all in bits I was like ‘eh?’ 😂 but I’ve reread it and oh my God how lovely. I think I know who wrote it but I don’t want to be wrong and insult the writer so I’m going to leave it illusive.

But I think my favourite thing about the entire story is that it could be literally about anyone, and we’ll automatically have that one person we admire in mind.

summary: Recently we saw Harry & Louis MIA 24/7, as if they r inseparable,  and when Harry show up publicly, we see Louis show up at same...
body:
Recently we saw Harry & Louis MIA 24/7, as if they r inseparable, and when Harry show up publicly, we see Louis show up at same time !

But actually now while Louis and his family r grieving, & I am not talking about only him and his sisters & brother , but his grandparents, aunts, uncles, cousins … ect , Louis has to be with them at the house most of the time, he is the big brother to his family .. Thats why I guess we see Harry at day a lot the past few days, he is giving Louis the space to do his duties towards his family & relatives … And no one knows at the end of the day , how ppl spend their times, I guess for Larry “Next To You” is the main case here .

ps: Louis and Harry r in the closet & I guess still part of their relatives/family doesn’t know they r together.
